meanings.definition: The quality or state of being vertical.
meanings.sent1: The tall building displayed impressive verticalities.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting featured bold verticalities.
meanings.sent3: The verticalities of the tree made it look like a giant ruler.
meanings.sent4: Her determination stood as tall as the verticalities of a skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The verticalities of the cliffs were breathtaking against the blue sky.

meanings.sent1: The architect carefully planned the verticalities of the structure.
meanings.sent2: The stripes on the flag formed perfect verticalities.
meanings.sent3: The verticalities of the fence made it resemble a barcode.
meanings.sent4: The verticalities of the piano keys created a harmonious pattern.
meanings.sent5: The verticalities of the columns added elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: The condition of being perpendicular to the horizon.
meanings.sent1: The mountain range's verticalities were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The sailor used the stars to determine the verticalities of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The verticalities of the flagpole made it look like a giant needle.
meanings.sent4: The verticalities of the cliff face seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent5: The verticalities of the tower reached towards the sky.
